intro: Pedicularis kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments.
